It was presented in partnership with the institution.The theme of the fifth edition of the Biennial, “Sensuality in Everyday Life,” was: “In the course of a long life, the artist becomes the human being, the subject, the object, the image.” The exhibition will focus on the contemporary practice of the lenses, mirrors, and mirrors that have been used to show the body’s physical and psychological phenomena over the course of the artist’s career.“We are thrilled to continue to present the work of the phenomenal Aurochska Kudacki,” said the Biennial’s artistic director, Teodoro Cipolletta. “Her work is a source of inspiration that is endlessly relevant in the midst of this current moment, in the midst of the present and future.”
